website_summaries.verdict: Customers seeking a party game sure to make everyone laugh should check out this meme-centered masterpiece.
pros: Comes with 75 photo cards of famous and current memes
Offers 360 caption cards to match the meme photos, helping users make custom memes each round
cons: A few owners complain that the game can get boring after a few rounds due to the game's low card number

customer_reviews.title: I have a good sense of humor and fun but I found it ...
customer_reviews.text: This should be listed as XX rated, not simply as an adult game. I have a good sense of humor and fun but I found it rude, crude and disgusting. I would have given it no stars if I could have.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: So smutty and I did not get the smutty version.
customer_reviews.author: online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t like it
customer_reviews.text: I know it’s an “adult” game but I found there were too many cards with the “F” word and pictures I didn’t find appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Waldvogel

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait to play again!
customer_reviews.text: This game is a blast!!! I played once with friends and after going through all the Meme photos I dug into some wedding pictures I had printed. That was hilarious and a game changer- literally! The second time i played was with a huge group and I stole funny awkward pictures from their Facebook pages before we met and sent them to Walgreens to be printed. The look on their faces when I pulled out some gems of pictures was almost as fun as memeing them!! My 85 year old grandma even got into the fun and only wanted to play with the family photos I had printed. We'll definitely be playing again soon!
customer_reviews.author: E. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Game Night!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been hearing a lot about this game recently so I figured I’d join in. I bought this game for my mom because she loves to hold Game Night parties. I must say it’s one of the best games I’ve ever played. It definitely makes for a good laugh. It was a huge hit at her last Game Night. I highly recommend this. ***If helpful, please click ‘Helpful’*** :)
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Even getting drunk didn’t improve this lame game.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, my expectations were high. Wow, did they come crashing down. I have a feeling this was invented by a bunch of college boys who were drinking too much...or maybe not enough. So banal and too juvenile! 90% of the captions weren’t at all funny and certainly not clever, pictures were almost all totally lame. I’ve seen better stuff on one quick meme search on Google. Plus, there’s no point to the game except endlessly collecting points. You are better off showing your own pics on your phone and having everyone make up a meme for each one. This game was not thought through at all. Can’t believe someone actually paid to print it.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t wanna spoil the game with pictures..
customer_reviews.text: This was actually a really funny game! 435 cards (360 caption cards and 75 photo cards). Also came with a NSFW booster pack and easel. Plays the same as cards against humanity and apples to apples. Don’t see anywhere to buy extra caption cards as if you do a group of people for 10-20 rounds you’ll be using duplicates. But the meme cards are the viral images you’re all familiar with. Safe to play with most ages unless You’re using the booster pack
customer_reviews.author: JenniferTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Vulgar
customer_reviews.text: This could have been a great game. It’s so vulgar that it’s bound to be offensive to someone at the game table. Age listed on the game is 17+. There is absolutely no way you would want a 17 year old to play this game. I would not be comfortable playing this game with my adult children and they would hate playing it with their parents.
customer_reviews.author: Lora Hoppes

customer_reviews.title: Nah...
customer_reviews.text: Not entertaining at all. Vulgarity without the humor. Stick with Cards against Humanity.
customer_reviews.author: T. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Vulgar
customer_reviews.text: I felt it was vulgar and crossed the line with inappropriate language...and that was just on the regular cards. The mature cards were even more offensive. I am sending this back for a full refund. I was embarrassed starting to play this game with our 19 year old son...we were pulling out inappropriate cards and setting them to the side as we played. Yuck...
customer_reviews.author: W. Salerno

customer_reviews.title: Totally Lame
customer_reviews.text: Stupid game OK Cards against humanity was cute This tries to take this concept and expand on it Bad idea and zero fun Crude isn’t automatically funny And this is a perfect example of that
customer_reviews.author: Syracuse Pete

customer_reviews.title: Even with That's What She Said and Cards Against Humanity, we seem to always go back to What Do You Meme
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy board games nights with friends occasionally, where we play a wide variety of board and party games. In terms of adult humor, I really do enjoy both That's What She Said and Cards Against Humanity, but my friends always seem to want to play at least one round every time of What Do You Meme. The Memes themselves are pretty well-known and funny in their own way which is a bonus. Pretty simple, very funny, great addition to any party.
customer_reviews.author: Mayra S.

customer_reviews.title: Xtremely adult, unfortunately not funny
customer_reviews.text: Stupid. I'm not a prude, I think CAH is hilarious, but these cards are just disgusting. It's like they tried to come up with the dirtiest and most vile sayings to put on the cards, and they are not even funny.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for social events
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the afterparty fun for our last beer pong tournament. From the minute it was unboxed everyone was really interested in the game. We played with 3 couples and had a blast! The game is simple and very entertaining. We did pass on using the red cards, which would have probably made the game even better had we played it right. The ONLY negative feedback I have to give is we found a grammar error on one card... which was surprising! No worries though. 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.NoBS

customer_reviews.title: The most hilarious game you will EVER play!
customer_reviews.text: The night our family played this game is the best night we've had in over ten years. We all laughed so hard we were in physical pain. I absolutely love this game and I would recommend it to anyone who loves playing games, laughing and a good time. The only slight downside the game has is that it is completely raunchy at times and people who are uncomfortable with questionable moral humor should avoid the game. If you are easily offended you shouldn't play this game. Other than that, it is the best game I have played in years and I played it with my father, a former minister who is not easily offended, and other family members.
customer_reviews.author: Janet L. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift and it was a lot of fun (and resulted in a lot of laughs)!!! I would beware before playing with your family (made that mistake) as their are MANY inappropriate/uncomfortable cards in there (that would be funny if you were just with friends). There are a few rape jokes and a few about Christianity, which I wish was not included, as I don't find joking about either of those matters to be funny. However, we just discarded those right away and didn't let it get us down. We still had a lot of fun with this. Would recommend for any meme-lover :)
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Total disappointment. Barely two rounds and we were bored. Everyone complained that the cards stunk, and that was after swapping their cards multiple times. There were 8 of us ranging in age from 23 to 77, all well versed in CAH, and yes, booze was involved. The meme game just seemed tired and done before. There was nothing surprising. Nothing new and different. Save your $30 and find something else to play.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t make the same mistake I made.
customer_reviews.text: Read this entire review before purchasing so you don’t make the same mistakes I made. This game is not funny. At all. Honestly, I had high hopes for this game, with the good ratings and all. But not one line in the deck of cards made me even laugh out loud...or much at all. And the images were not very funny either. And I can’t return this item unless I drive at least half an hour away to drop off this item at an Amazon locker or 15 minutes away at the nearest Kohl’s for the return to be free. Otherwise, I can choose UPS and return it for a little less than $9. C’est la vie.
customer_reviews.author: Quynh Le

customer_reviews.title: Distasteful
customer_reviews.text: Distasteful! I bought this game to play on Christmas with the family and to my surprise it was full of secular innuendo and foul language to the point of being vulgar. So embarrassing!! I went through all the cards and threw away all the cards that had vulgar and easily the others that I could. I should have returned the game but I really enjoy the ‘concept’ of the game. I can tolerate a lot but this game was beyond my tolerance level. Please do not purchase this game...unless all you care about is trashy language and degrading sexual ‘jokes’.
customer_reviews.author: ISay

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious adults only game!!
customer_reviews.text: This game is hilarious! Not for the faint of heart as there's lots of foul language and inappropriate cards. We played this at my brother's 27th birthday party and everyone loved it! Very much like CAH. I like the fact that you can take pictures of your friends making random faces or gestures and print them out and add them to the other pictures just to add personal touch to the game. :)
customer_reviews.author: April W.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Massively fun and of course, inappropriate.
customer_reviews.text: Do you love cards against humanity? Then you will LOVE this game. Other than the easel for the photos being a little flimsy and blowing away when we play around the fire pit or falling over on the table if it gets bumped, I am incredibly happy. You will need at least 3 people to play this and of course, the more the merrier. Buy this right now and call all of your friends. You're about to have a he!! of a good time! The more twisted your mind is, the better.
customer_reviews.author: BethieRocksHard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent game!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! The base pack is perfect and fun just how it is, unlike other card games where you need to buy a few expansion packs before it's any fun. With 4 people play lasted about an hour. Caption cards are pretty tame. Surprised there were some popular memes not included (success kid, "all the...", Pepe, abs doge)
customer_reviews.author: CatMom

customer_reviews.title: This game is hilarious!
customer_reviews.text: Love this game. Have played it several times with my family although getting the extension packs would probably be recommended. The game has plenty of cards with the memes on them and plenty of cards with the sayings on them but one can go through them in an evening pretty quickly. The game is hilarious and relatively safe to play with kids in the room. There is a set of "explicit adult' cards in the box that are wrapped separately. They are VERY ADULT and not for the faint hearted. Either way, awesome game and highly recommend. Brings tons of laughs.
customer_reviews.author: Amy VanGundy

customer_reviews.title: No thanks
customer_reviews.text: Not ideal. The memes are out dated and not exciting. It wasn’t really a good time and we lost interest really quickly. I wish I could return it. I would not buy this or suggest it. For this type of game, I think at least the meme part of it needs to be electronic to stay relevant.
customer_reviews.author: brookelynn

customer_reviews.title: X-RATED / NOT FAMILY APPROPRIATE
customer_reviews.text: I’m all for humor and and fun sex talk, but this game goes over the top! Played with my parents and age appropriate family members and was thoroughly embarrassed! The cards were mostly disgusting ... topics ranging from orgys, to using coke/drugs, and B jobs! Beware - there are 2 sets of cards, both pretty sexual and disgusting! I would like to return for a refund but it’s probably not possible?
customer_reviews.author: S&K S

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious Party Game
customer_reviews.text: We always play games with our family, so we decided to gift this when we were visiting over the Thanksgiving holiday. I was concerned with my daughter and niece playing (they're both 12), but the cards weren't too bad, and we kept the NSFW cards separate so they could enjoy playing with us. It was a hit! They wanted to play it all week long. Very funny, even without the adult cards added to the deck. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kate McG

customer_reviews.title: Funny
customer_reviews.text: Pretty funny game. The memes in this are pretty old memes though. Nothing current. We ended up adding our own homemade meme cards to the deck. If your getting as a family games, it's worth noting that I had to filter out half the deck, that includes the adult pack that is included in this game. It's still a fun game though, especially if you have teenagers. With new more current memes added this would be a hilarious game to play at a party for adults.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Taylor

customer_reviews.title: A fun game that anyone can play (even my father who ...
customer_reviews.text: A fun game that anyone can play (even my father who doesn't know what a meme is). Some of the cards are a little risque, but nothing compared to other games like Cards Against Humanity. Still, there are PG-17 versions of sexual ones that make playing with family/parents a bit awkward. There's a stack of postcard-sized meme images which you get to take your pick of and then have your group submit captions for. That was something different than other card games like this where the "judge" draws randomly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun but racy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my preteens who love internet memes. Turns out playing these kinds of games with them is frustrating because they have a childish sense of humor. They liked it though. My only complaint is that, even though there was a section of the deck that was sealed as "mature" there were still several mature cards in the deck. I guess it says for adults so I can't really complain. Just be aware. Fun game though!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: So many awesome memes out there they could have used
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this game so much, but it just disappointed. I love memes, as I think most people in the social media world do, and there are too many good ones out there that I was sorely disappointed in the memes they picked for this game. We play adult party games at least once a month, and this one just isn't on the top of our list. I honestly don't know if there are extensions, but I wouldn't bother even if there were. I also think it was way too close to CAH, so it didn't give much variety to our game choices that we have.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi L. Sheidy

customer_reviews.title: Old memes and not our type of humor
customer_reviews.text: My adult kids love memes, but even they found this tired in the options. I found most of the captions not that clever and we didn't give more than a few chuckles when we played. The very "adult" captions were separated out and we didn't even use those since we found the regular not that funny. I don't recommend this game at all.
customer_reviews.author: Annette B

customer_reviews.title: Not as fun as I first thought
customer_reviews.text: This game seems intriguing at first glance, but after playing, it's not as fun as I initially thought. I understand that this game isn't the newest thing on the block, but most these memes are kinda dated, or I've not even seen them before. In other words, this game can be fun, but dont expect it to feel new or current. I know that there are expansion packs too, some of these may be a little more current than the starter pack, but keep this in mind when you buy. Also, gameplay feels like it gets boring fast.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic adult game for groups!
customer_reviews.text: Family Christmas usually goes like this: all of the older adults sitting in groups of 2 or 3 all over the house or just watching the kids play with their toys, getting bored and the 20-somethings just staring at their phones. This Christmas: We played What Do You Meme and it was so much fun! No phones came out, everyone stayed involved and we were in tears from laughing so hard most of the night! This has become one of our favorites and we will be getting additional card sets
customer_reviews.author: S Price

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious Family-friendly game
customer_reviews.text: For those who are wondering if this game is family friendly, I would definitely say so. When you open the box; the “Mature Content” Caption Cards are wrapped and separated from the rest of the caption cards. I went through all the rest of the cards and found approx 20-30 cards that were PG-13. The rest were PG which was at least 200+ caption cards. There were only about 5 memes that were inappropriate for children. Once I set those aside or threw them away, we played and had a great time! Haven’t laughed that good in awhile!
customer_reviews.author: Davemojo

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my oldest son as a gift. The whole family played it over Christmas break and had a great time. It has a separate pack of "mature" cards which we didn't use because I have younger teens. Even then some of the captions were a little inappropriate but they either weren't that offensive or went over their heads so it wasn't concerning. It IS an adult game and we knew that going in. I think it's a game you could replay a lot of times, especially with different groups of people.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: If you’re looking for a different group card game, this is it.
customer_reviews.text: I was browsing the internet for a fun group card game that wasn’t Cards Against Humanity when I came across this gem. My family and I dabble heavily into memes so I knew this would be a great fit. I planned a party specifically set around playing this and when the day finally came, it was totally worth it. Every round there was so much laughter we couldn’t speak. The nature content cards are separated from the rest of the deck but she shuffled them in and it was great.
customer_reviews.author: Tianna

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because we have been under a stay at home order and there is only so much you can do on the computer and so much TV. We played with our family and I ended up buying the family edition too. This version has some adult aspects and an extra section that is labeled "adults only". It is absolutely fine for teenagers and is lots of fun. My father is older and said it was the best fun he had had in weeks. Having never seen a MEME before he was thrilled with the pics.
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: Absolute easy fun for adults!
customer_reviews.text: This game is like Apples to Apples (better for families) or Cards Against Humanity (adults only) but our friends thought it was MORE fun because you not only have funny answers but HILARIOUS photos. Also takes very little thought so easy to play after a few drinks ;) Adults only!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A. Murray

customer_reviews.title: WARNING NOT APPROPRIATE FOR TWEENS!
customer_reviews.text: So admittedly this is my fault. My daughter played this game at a friends party. A friend who we are fairly close with so I did not so my research and assumed it was appropriate. Well my friends it is NOT! Nothing like playing this game with your Dad Husband and 12 year old to discover even the “regular cards” are mature content. It is like cards against humanity but with memes. Exactly the same concept. It’s hilarious but for sure ADULT only!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!!
customer_reviews.text: We played this last night at girls night in and it’s a riot. There’s a regular pack and a separate pack of card options for “mature” and we were all in tears and snorting because the content is offensive-hilarious. Super fun and highly recommend. Came back to amazon today to purchase an expansion pack because we want more of this game. It’s easy, and we played with 8 people by making teams. Just buy it and prepare to have a great time!
customer_reviews.author: Holden & Greys Mama

customer_reviews.title: My new "go to" gift!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a FUN game! And it makes a unique gift that works for everyone. If you have someone in your life that is difficult to buy for - meaning they pretty much have everything they need or just buy it for themselves if they want something - this is the PERFECT gift! As a hostess gift, housewarming gift, birthday, holiday gift. Great for college kids, parents, neighbors. Works for both close friends/family and the new people in your life that you aren't sure about what to give as a gift. Our typical "go to" gift was a nice bottle of liquor. Now it's this game!
customer_reviews.author: Mel S

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: I discovered this game sort of by accident. My friends and I were at a lakeside camp this summer and this game was just there on a shelf. We decided to take it to the dock and start playing. Well we had lots of laughs and so much fun. Admittedly, there was a bit of alcohol involved but nonetheless a fun game to play with friends. So, I decided to purchase the game to share with more people but be aware that this is an adult game.
customer_reviews.author: Raphie C.

customer_reviews.title: S'alright game.
customer_reviews.text: Don't worry if there are people in your group who aren't on social media enough to dabble in memes, they will also enjoy this game, I promise. While the memes are a bit dated, there are some good ones in there. I'd recommend playing music while you play to hide the lack of laughter from weak cards. The only thing I really didnt care for was the raunchy cards. More than half of them weren't even funny, if you do want to have them in your pile, I would go through them first. The drunker you are the more funny and relaxed the game gets.
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: This game is SO much fun!! We played it with our 22 and ...
customer_reviews.text: This game is SO much fun!! We played it with our 22 and 20 year old children on Christmas Eve and we laughed throughout the entire game! They texted their friends that they couldn't believe they were playing it with their parents, but that they had a great time! Definitely NOT for kids under 18 in our opinion! But I bought it again for a couple of friends and they love it too!
customer_reviews.author: anne21596

customer_reviews.title: Perfect game for your less uptight friends/family!
customer_reviews.text: This game is hilarious and many of the cards are raunchier than Cards Against Humanity. I have played this with family, friends, and coworkers (be sure they won't report you to Human Resources ha ha) and everyone has been grossed out, laughed until they cried or peed their pants, personally related to the meme or the card, etc. I can't wait for more expansion packs to be released. I was worried that there wasn't enough memes to keep the game fresh but what I have found is that when playing you go through all the cards faster than you go through all the memes... and you can always add in your own!
customer_reviews.author: M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: fun
customer_reviews.text: this is a fun game to play with 4 or more people. but be warned it does come with some very vulgar caption cards, which are labeled as such, but the meme photo cards are not separated by any categories, and some of them are a little risque'; so keep that in mind if you don't want to be a part of some inappropriateness. also, i would recommend that this game only be visible and audible by people 18 and older.
customer_reviews.author: melissa ward

customer_reviews.title: I do think it was unnecessary for it to be dirty
customer_reviews.text: I'm not exactly observant...so I did not realize that this was an "adult" game. I do think it was unnecessary for it to be dirty. But we just removed the cards we didn't like. It's basically a meme version of Cards Against Humanity. There are some nasty ones. But it's a lot of fun. We played through every picture the first time we played it!
customer_reviews.author: Grace Gilliam

customer_reviews.title: Hours of hilarious fun!
customer_reviews.text: This game is hysterical! I received it for Christmas and played with my adult children and family members for 3 hours. Definitely for adults only. The captions are inappropriate but not racial. I also took it to an adult neighborhood party and I think everyone went home and ordered one off Amazon! If you want to laugh your tail off, this is the game for you! If you get offended easily, maybe not.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great game for both friends and family.
customer_reviews.text: This game is a great gift for the hard to buy for young adult. Our 25 year old son got this for Christmas and we played for hours into the night. Easy way to bring a group together and a great ice breaker when you have some new/quiet personalities to add to your group. The game works for varied age groups, is easy to learn and evokes many laughs. Would buy again and recommend for friends.
customer_reviews.author: Monica From nj

customer_reviews.title: A little too crude for us (and we are not sensitive)
customer_reviews.text: Phew, it was funny but also VERY crude. And I say that coming from a family/friends group that plays Cards Against Humanity regularly... And this was just like, toooo much. I wish every single text card didnt have to be so shocking... It was like taking every super crude CAH card and using all of those with no alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Loo

customer_reviews.title: Very long captions - stopped playing after 2 meme cards
customer_reviews.text: We stopped playing this game just after playing 2 meme cards. The captions on the caption cards are way too long. First of all in a group, there is a lot of noise as everyone is talking. And when these captions are too long, its very hard for everyone to understand what the captions mean. Secondly, if you are drunk then dont even think of playing this game as the long captions make difficult to understand. Overall, the game concept is good but the captions should be smaller.
customer_reviews.author: swapy

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly, one of the funnest and funniest games I've ever played.
customer_reviews.text: We thought we'd play this game for a few minutes and then shelf it. It had good ratings and would be a nice addition to our card game collection. However, what followed was the entire family playing this game for several hours, some laughing so hard they choked on snacks and one even peed herself. Highly recommended for any group of people that love memes, have a sense of humor and enjoy a date night spent doing something OTHER than watching Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: Alexia Aleza Decker

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This game was a lot of fun, we played with four people. The instructions were good, very easy. We are "cards against humanity" fans so this was a very nice change. The game could use more meme photo cards, we ran out and had to keep putting our own winning cards back in. It was a very funny game even with no alcohol..lol
customer_reviews.author: Myndilyn - Nevada

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelmed
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an age appropriate game. If you’re looking for something similar to cards against humanity to break out during a dinner party this is not the one. We played it with my fiancé’s parents which I thought would be better since it’s PG but it actually was just boring. I only took off one star although I returned it because this may fit someone else’s needs for a family friendly game, but I personally was underwhelmed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun but sprinkled with inappropriate
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I love this game. However, there are a few things about it. I wouldn't be able to gift this to friends because it has so many crude cards and several with cuss words. Not real family friendly. Also had to pull some of the picture cards out because they were inappropriate. The rest of the cards are good. Some of the pictures are zoomed in a little too close...but that's not much of an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: After all the great reviews, I expected this game to be fun. BORING! Probably a drinking game...
customer_reviews.text: After reading many many of the reviews, I ordered the game and an additional pack so the fun could keep on coming. However, the images (that get the memes) and the comment cards just did not align. We thought some of the comments were pretty funny especially some of the risque ones. However, the birthday party of 13 year old girls were unimpressed and found this game to be a dud. They were good sports and gave it a second chance later in the day - with the same results. This game is probably pretty funny if you're drinking alcohol. Before booting it out completely, I'll have a go with adults.
customer_reviews.author: Silkflower

customer_reviews.title: Definitely 17+ age group
customer_reviews.text: I know it says 17 yrs on the box... I bought it for my tween as he is very into memes and pretty savvy to relevant topics online. I had to remove a large chunk of adult topics that I didn’t want him seeing. But I’ll save those for another time when I have my adult friends play :) nothing wrong with the game, I just wasn’t prepared for lines about private parts 🤦🏼‍♀️😂
customer_reviews.author: Mongoose

customer_reviews.title: NOT family appropriate
customer_reviews.text: This game was such a missed opportunity for a fun family game. There is an expansion pack with a “warning mature content” label on it, so I figured that the regular game which does not feature a warning label would be safe. No so. Not child appropriate. Not family appropriate. Not gifting appropriate. The regular game features A LOT of adult content. Be warned. Why couldn’t you make a family version of this?!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Fun game a couple of times
customer_reviews.text: Fun game to play a couple times with friends, but gets repetitive pretty quickly. It's sort of just a knock off of "Apples to Apples" or "Cards Against Humanity", but with more pictures instead of words. However, the problem is that memes go out of date more quickly, so after a couple years, the memes are worn and not as funny, taking some of the fun out of the game.
customer_reviews.author: Jake W.

customer_reviews.title: Like Apples to Apples, but with funny meme images
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift and it was fun to play! The game play reminded me of Apples to Apples (or Cards Against Humanity). We definitely laughed a lot! I think the recipient will enjoy this gift for years to come. We didn't open the "adult card" pack, but some cards in the regular pack seemed a bit "adult" to me. Might want to review some of the text cards before letting young kids play.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait to play
customer_reviews.text: My product came on time and as pictured. I couldn't wait to open it and see what it looked like. I haven't actually played yet but just reading the cards made me giggle so I can't wait to pull this out for the holidays with my friends and family. Now some of the cards are a little racy so if you have family or friends who get uncomfortable with topics of sex you might want to go through and pick out those cards.
customer_reviews.author: NaturallySassy

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious
customer_reviews.text: This game is hilarious. Very similar to Cards Against Humanity, but it uses pictures instead of black cards with phrases. Definitely some colorful responses, which had us laugh trying to blurt them out and others crying from hearing them. I went into this knowing nothing but I'm so happy I purchased it. Be sure you know what this game is about before opting to play with certain groups of people (family, coworkers, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Ashfont

customer_reviews.title: Beware when purchasing the expansion packs!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the game and the first two expansion packs as well. While the game itself is fun, we were greatly disappointed with the fact that alot of our cards from one of the expansion packs were all duplicates of the ones in the original game pack. So beware when buying expansion packs, it's a bit of a hoax.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Louise

customer_reviews.title: Wraps beautifully
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my closest friends and I to play while camping. I haven't given it to them yet because we won't see each other for at least another month but I can say with confidence that these sick people will love this game! And I can't wait to play with them. I can say with confidence that I was able to wrap this gift beautifully so please don't let the fear of wrapping hold you back from purchasing this item LOL. I can't wait to start playing this game with my crazy friends thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Desiree A. Passantino

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you part the inappropriate ones, they aren’t parted properly!
customer_reviews.text: Sooooo it has a deck that is adult only! Which separates the pack. BUT I came across ALOT of inappropriate ones while using the innocent deck. Other than that it’s fun! Mix some of your family pictures in and it makes me 10 times funner. The meme stand broke the first day. I recommend putting mod podge over it so it’s a little harder. Not so cheap cardboard
customer_reviews.author: Sk8 Mamii

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious game, well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Really hilarious game. The instructions are super easy to understand, and everything came as described. I think this game is meant more for a younger crowd (grandparents and parents might not understand the subtext of Pepe the Frog, or "y tho", so a younger crowd is probably better. With that said, my mother and father-in-law both had a ton of laughs and fun. The game is similar to Apples to Apples or Cards Against Humanity. The pictures are a nice differentiating factor!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Never laughed so hard.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it four stars because a third of the game is VERY inappropriate for my tastes. Although, I’m sure others would enjoy that. I took all the “inappropriate” ones out for my family and we have NEVER laughed so hard. I even got my uncle to play and he never plays games. Once the concept of a meme was explained it was so funny. I originally got it for my husband, who loves memes, but now it’s one of my favorite games. It reminds me of a modern apples to apples with pictures. LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Sean kight

customer_reviews.title: Take your game night to another level!
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a fun addition to our weekly game night! The caption cards are hilarious and since there are so many, you don't often see to many repeats from game to game. My only criticism is that the memes get a little boring and repetitive after playing the game many times, but there is an option to use your own memes so one could easily print out some replacement memes or even pull one up on your phone. Love the mature audience cards and the easel is helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Josh & Jessica Kittle

customer_reviews.title: Uninspired and tasteless
customer_reviews.text: When I read the premise of this game I thought this would be a clever game. I was so disappointed that I returned the game. The pictures were mostly just pictures of people's faces and the description cards were best described as unimaginative and crude. The "joke" would be who drew the raunchiest card. I didn't see much creativity in this game which is a shame because it could have been a very entertaining game. I guess everyone's idea of "entertainment" is not the same.
customer_reviews.author: geckomom

customer_reviews.title: A fun game with many laughs
customer_reviews.text: This game is a lot like cards against humanity in the sense that someone judges on who has the funniest or most relatable card to the meme in question. I gifted this game for Christmas and we’ve played it three times now. Some of the cards are not funny, some are, and others are just down right I appropriate (in a funny way). I would not recommend playing it if you have children around unless you remove the dirty cards. I like that you can but expansion packs also.
customer_reviews.author: CMac26

customer_reviews.title: Cards Against Humanity for the visual learners
customer_reviews.text: I love this game! This is like Cards Against Humanity for the visual learners --like. I highly recommend this game to play with friends. It might not be the best game to play at family gatherings, and definitely not at work, as it has some card phrases that people might find too racy. The meme and phrases cards are well made, and it comes with a small cardboard easel. Expansion packs are also available for this game, and I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Pepe

customer_reviews.title: Great game, Died laughing
customer_reviews.text: It is a version of cards against humanity. We played it for the first time last night and had a blast. When you can match the perfect caption with the perfect picture you will bust out laughing. They are a few cards were I literally LMFAO. The cards are good quality and will last a while. The directions are very easy to understand and sarcastic. Oh and when the says age 17+ I would stay with that recommendation or just filter out the adult caption cards for the little ones.
customer_reviews.author: christina gifford

customer_reviews.title: Eh, not crazy over it.
customer_reviews.text: Not as fun as Cards Against Humanity. Kinda got bored after a while. I'm gonna say I would not have bought it if I had played it at someone else's place. I bought it based on the video and they made it seem like it was hilarious. It's just ok. You don't have to run to buy this one. You can walk and mosey on over if you feel like it.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Shields

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: As a huge fan of Cards Against Humanity, I was interested in how What Do You Meme would compare and I wasn’t disappointed. It was a lot of fun to play with my 20-something sons. I wouldn’t recommend it for kids or young teens as the “regular” cards aren’t much cleaner than the “adult” cards! Some of the caption cards were kinda lame, but not too bad for a first edition. Looking forward to seeing what the expansion packs have in store!
customer_reviews.author: Dana B

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend for families
customer_reviews.text: Bought to play with my older teenage kiddos— we didn’t even open the ‘mature’ pack of cards and I didn’t think to check each card before they were dealt and we had some red faces, bleeped out words and lots of embarrassment at the table. I immediately gathered up the cards, looked them over and was thoroughly disgusted at what passes as ‘family friendly’ nowadays. I opened the ‘mature’ pack to see how much more ‘adult’ the game could get, and it was so horrific I decided I don’t even want the damn game in my house so I returned and got a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni MacArthur

customer_reviews.title: Good fun!
customer_reviews.text: Non-stop laughter- sometimes awkward, sometimes silly, sometimes inappropriate, but always funny! A few cards are generationally-challenged, but this made it more fun laughing at others' ignorance of current trends in social media (grandpa may not know what Snapchat is, for example). Hearing Grandma speaking about vaginas is hilarious! Booster packs will be necessary fairly quickly, as the cards rotated through with just 7 of us playing.
customer_reviews.author: MSA

customer_reviews.title: Has us in stitches laughing every day
customer_reviews.text: We bought this game for our teenage children who have played it daily since the purchase. It is hilarious - you select a photo from the pile (all seem to be from popular memes), and then you look through your cards to find the funniest caption that you submit for judging. It is the same concept as Apples to Apples. Some of the regular cards are very risqué, we haven’t allowed our kids to open the separate pack of “adult” cards that came with the game!
customer_reviews.author: TheFordFamily4

customer_reviews.title: Really fun, simple rules, lots of laughs
customer_reviews.text: This game is totally fun. Had our group laughing to the point of aching sides and faces. Rules are super simple and much like Cards Against Humanity, but with memes. Is NOT kid appropriate, and this applies to adult kids -- I would feel very awkward playing with either of my parents, and my friends all agreed. We went thru all of the meme cards in about an hour, so game time length is just about right also. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JayneDoah

customer_reviews.title: Kind of dirty
customer_reviews.text: I had never played this game before and thought it would be fun for our vacation with friends, but there is a lot of use of the f- word and lots of inappropriate things. I don't mind a little bit of that, but this game kind of overdid it in that area for me. Cards Against Humanity was about as far as i can go with that sort of stuff. Still a fun game and love the concept.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: No just no
customer_reviews.text: My brother wanted this crap, but we only played it once (jerk) lol. It was a waste of money, and I guess maybe he didn't know how truly dirty it was! So much for wanting to do something nice, that usually goes unappreciated. I know better next time. Plus a lot of the pics seem the same, and are boring, they deff need more pics, though you could make up your own or use your phone who wants to do that with something you paid for..Lots of explanation cards or w/e, not enough pics!
customer_reviews.author: Leah B.

customer_reviews.title: Great idea - Really Crappy Pictures
customer_reviews.text: Great idea ... not so great pictures. I'll add that a lot of the memes run into the disgusting and vulgar, but I realize that's not too big a deal for many people. I just sorted them out. The pictures, though. Really low quality images and more than half look like stuff you'd just delete from your phone because it was a bad angle or focus -not because of expression or situation. Several pix are also of current political figures which will quickly become dated or create stupid conversations in the midst of a game that should be entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: Salina Breeze

customer_reviews.title: Know Your Audience
customer_reviews.text: This 50 year old would have given this game 3 stars; my 20 year old daughter would give it 5 stars. We played this game with parents and 20-somethings. We had fun, but even though I have teenagers and feel like I'm in touch with social media, my husband and I felt the generation gap playing this game. The 20-somethings thought it was great. A great game for the 20-30 year olds. Also good for teenagers if you do not use the "mature content" cards.
customer_reviews.author: rbkosmo

customer_reviews.title: Fun but limited
customer_reviews.text: The game was super fun at first, then I realized it’s because they only had a small deck or cards that were actually funny (adult rated and vulgar) then there was a large stack of cards that were more kid friendly. When I purchased it, I got it because I wanted an adult game. Only about 15 min into the game with 5 of us playing we were completely out of the “Adult cards” and everyone pretty much lost interest after that point. It was hilarious while using that small, inappropriate deck or cards though. I really wish there were more of them.
customer_reviews.author: Tinielle Cassity

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy game to play
customer_reviews.text: This game was fun and easy to play. I liked the stand that came in the box that can be used to display the photos. I wish it hadn't included political photos and I had hoped the pictures would have been funnier or strange (how many photos of a sloth do you need?). Anyway, I got both expansion packs so I hoped the selection of pictures are better in those.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa L.

customer_reviews.title: Fun game!
customer_reviews.text: To be clear this is an adult game. With that if you haven’t played this is so much fun! If you like cards against humanity it’s kind of similar in that each person hands in a card saying to go with the picture for whoever’s turn it is to decide what card matches or is funniest for the picture. Definitely worth it for game night.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Creativity and laughter make for a great game night.
customer_reviews.text: We played with a group of siblings. The pictures were hilarious as were the cards in the set. Sometimes you had great cards to choose from, other times the choices weren't the greatest, but the laughter and hilarity that ensued was worth it. Freestyle was the best. You could be creative and correlate your words to the picture given. It was a blast.
customer_reviews.author: sdbunny

customer_reviews.title: Super fun! But some adult cards slipped through the cracks.
customer_reviews.text: This game is incredibly fun. It’s very similar to Apples to Apples. You gotta know how to read the room, otherwise you’re not going to win. I like that the super inappropriate cards are separate from the rest, so if you don’t find that sort of thing funny, you don’t have to use them. My only complaint is there were several cards that were still inappropriate that were in the normal deck.
customer_reviews.author: Cool People

customer_reviews.title: Brush up your meme game!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a really fun game and would be even more fun if people actually would play to the photos and not just end up choosing the most raunchy card that was played. I feel some of the photo cards could be taken out completely, however, I appreciate the game appealing to many different types of humor by having such a variety. Regardless of my opinion, I still laugh myself to tears every time when playing with the right people! It’s a must have party game.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Magness

customer_reviews.title: fun game
customer_reviews.text: played it with family from age 17 to 70. There were a few cards i removed ahead of time. We had a lot of fun with the game. there was a lot of laughing. this is sure to be one of our go to games depending on the age. I wouldn't play it with my 13 year old granddaughter
customer_reviews.author: Kathi Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Solid Pick for Game Night and Social Gatherings
customer_reviews.text: This game is always a huge hit at social gatherings. It’s similar to Cards Against Humanity but the czar card is a picture and the phrase cards are more relevant and creative (I would seriously like to meet the group of people that wrote these cards). If you’re looking for a fun and entertaining group game, this one is a solid pick! It’s pricey but it’s money well spent. Side note: this game features adult content/humor, it is not kid-friendly!
customer_reviews.author: Maria S.

customer_reviews.title: Pepe cards
customer_reviews.text: No one told me I would be purchasing something with Pepe cards inside. As everyone knows these cards are a symbol of hate and used by the alt-right. I did not open my pack upon first receiving it as I was thinking of giving it as a gift, but I am so glad I did not do share the hate. However, I waited too long where I could not return it for a refund, so now I'm stuck with this terrible thing. Which the game is not that fun even when I removed the 5 Pepe racist cards.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Robertson

customer_reviews.title: This is an ADULT game- don’t miss that!
customer_reviews.text: I somehow missed this was an adult party game! I gave it to my daughter as an early Christmas gift so we could play with friends at Thanksgiving. I was horrified as the kids started reading their cards. There are at least 50 super inappropriate cards. This is definitely an ADULT game, but I don’t even feel comfortable with those cards.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine T.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Adult
customer_reviews.text: Clearly, I didn't read the reviews in advance of purchase for this game. It is horrible, I wouldn't play it with my best friends, let alone family. This was a $20 mistake that I'm sick about; to think I bought it to play with family on Christmas Eve... ewwww.
customer_reviews.author: MPM

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not for mixed company
customer_reviews.text: I left a similar review for one of the expansion packs. This is a dirty fun game for adults. I was not comfortable with some of the cards while playing it with my children who are in their early 20s. If you are with people who share your sense of humor it's a lot of fun, but not a game for mixed company or conservative thinkers.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Baker

customer_reviews.title: This is such a funny game!
customer_reviews.text: Ok first of all we really like the game. Really fun and brought a lot of laughs. Some of the memes are somewhat inappropriate for younger children or mixed company. I'd suggest just going through the cards first and filter out the ones you deem inappropriate. But overall a great game that had the family engaged and laughing!
customer_reviews.author: mgetter

customer_reviews.title: If you love memes you’ll love this
customer_reviews.text: If you enjoy Cards Against Humanity and memes this is the ideal game for you. It’s combines my two loves so very well and the touch of having a little easel to display the photo is really extra but fun. Plus the expansion packs keep things fresh! As far as the seller goes they provided the product in good shape and on time. I couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Emerson

customer_reviews.title: This game is amazing and gives Cards Against Humanity a run for the money
customer_reviews.text: Similar to cards against humanity, but some of the answer cards are even more messed up and hilarious. Definitely not for kids but perfect for a game night with adults. We couldn’t stop laughing about some of the answers. Im already looking to buy an expansion pack, even though we haven’t even gotten close to seeing all the cards in the main game.
customer_reviews.author: Danny A

customer_reviews.title: FUN....
customer_reviews.text: I actually haven't played it yet but my 23 yr. old son and his friends are having a blast with it. They tell me "I won't get it as a 51 yr. old mom" but my husband and I intend on playing it with friends eventually and hopefully proving them wrong. LOL If you are buying this for an 18-25 yr. old, it will definitely be a hit! I can't say for sure if it will with a different age group yet. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Fox

customer_reviews.title: Not for the sensitive
customer_reviews.text: If your friends or family are prudes, born again, or simply sensitive or easily embarrassed then this game is not for them. Otherwise, it is hilarious especially if you have had a few drinks. It is often obscene, sexually suggestive, or morally reprehensible. If this appeals to you then you will love this game.
customer_reviews.author: D.B.

customer_reviews.title: Always a Crowd-Pleaser!
customer_reviews.text: Always a crowd-pleaser! I’ll host gatherings and pull this game out – it never disappoints. Hilarious, engaging, and worth noting is the quality of the product itself. As far as content, it’s not as “safe” as Apples to Apples but also doesn’t tread into Cards Against Humanity territory...perfect in between game in my experience. If looking for a game to add to your collection or a gift idea for a friend, one can’t go wrong with What Do You Meme.
customer_reviews.author: aliciamegan

product_meta.title: What Do You Meme? Party Game
feature_bullets: WARNING: Adults only: This game was created for ages 17+. There are some things you just can’t unhear. Trust us on this one.
HOW TO PLAY: compete with your friends and family to create the funniest memes. Do this by using one of your dealt caption cards to caption the photo card in each round.
WHO WILL BE CROWNED MEME QUEEN/KING: The winner of each round is decided by a rotating judge. Pro tip: pick your caption card to match the judge’s sense of humor.

WHAT’S INSIDE: Each What Do You Meme core game contains 435 cards. 360 of these are caption cards and 75 are photo cards. Printed on premium playing cards (thick with gloss finish); includes easel and bonus rules, shrink-wrapped in a custom box.

MORE FUN THIS WAY: Did you know that we make other awesome games? In addition to our core What Do You Meme game, there’s a lot more fun from What Do You Meme including eight expansion packs for our core What Do You Meme game (and counting), a custom storage box for all your cards, as well as NEW games like For The Girls and 4-Bidden Words. We’re also working on some family-friendly games in 2019 so stay tuned!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars16,467 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
